title: bride pays over 180 dream
story: Bride pays over £ for dream doughnut wedding cake - but what arrives is a messA bride has gone viral on social media after sharing a look at the dream wedding cake she ordered and the mess she was subsequently left with on her big dayShed ordered her dream cake Image: tiktok @just.a.saraByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsWhen it comes to weddings, for many they will hope everything goes perfect and smoothly - after all, they can cost a lot of money.One of the most expensive parts of the big day can often be the cake, with brides and grooms spending hundreds and even thousands on tiers of the sweet treat. In recent years weaposve seen dferent cake trends emerge, including wheels of cheese being stacked on top of one another and doughnut walls.For one woman, her dream cake combined cake and doughnuts and she thought sheaposd purchased just this after splashing over to have it made. However, what arrived on the day wasnapost exactly what sheaposd been hoping for. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Instead of three tiers of doughnuts, topped with a big cake, the bride was given a plate of doughnuts with a small cake in the middle.This cake fail was shared by a TikTok user named @just.a.sara who also shared that the delivery was an hour and a half late. Fellow TikTok users were horried by the clip, with one person replying: Grocery store doughnuts and a one-layer cake, nailed it.Someone  said: Couldnapost even spring for Krispy Kreme smh. A third wrote: A stack of tortillas surrounded by some bagels would have made me happier. I would have been livid.After the first video went viral, garnering over . million views, Sara later posted a follow-up explaining what happened at her wedding. She told viewers: You know something has to go wrong at every wedding and my wedding had three things. One my dress got botched two weeks before my wedding, two my husbandaposs ring showed up the morning of our wedding and three my cake and this is the story of my cake. Okay so there were several red flags before this but Iaposm gonna skip to the week of the wedding when I have this feeling that something is wrong, so I text her like aposHey Iaposm so excited to have the cake at the wedding on Saturdayapos and she text back saying aposgreatapos. Sara said she then checked whether there was anything  the baker needed from her and she said there wasnapost. However, when everyone arrived for the reception, the cake still hadnapost turned up. Eventually, the woman ran in with the cake - then the three-tier stand it was meant to be on broke. Luckily, the venue had a platter and my maid of honour and sister went out and set up this little cake thing which is like all we had. It was a mess, she shared. Sara recalls how she made eye contact with the baker and realised in the moment she had to aposlet it goapos to not let it ruin the day, but she was disappointed theyaposd spent so much money for what they received. Thankfully, they managed to get a full refund after the wedding, so allaposs well that ends well.Do you have a story to share  We want to hearall about it. title: i donated sperm without telling
story: I donated sperm without telling my we - she was fuming when she found outA man claims to have donated sperm a couple of years ago when he and his we were struggling, pulling in a bit of extra cash to help see them through the week - without telling her" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Health-Sample-sperm-Donor-Sperm-Close-Concept-of-Bank-Sperm-Infertility-A-Man-Holding-in-Hands-Co.jpg" width"" "" He didnt tell her as he didnt regard it as a big dealImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A man who claims to have found a way to bring in some extra cash a couple of years ago, during what was a financial rough patch for him and his we, has now found himself in a bit of a predicament. Having previously donated his sperm for payment as a struggling student, he decided to go down this route once again, pulling in £which helped see the couple comfortably through to the end of the week.He didnapost see this as a big deal at the time but opted not to tell his we. Until recently, heaposd forgotten about it completely, until a conversation with friends prompted him to bring it up. His we was not happy at this casual revelation and was left distressed by the thought that her husband may well have unknown biological children out in the world. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Taking to Reddit, the conflicted husband reveals he met his we in his final year of college, adding that they have now been married for six years.He wrote: We have our own children and everything is okay but a couple of years ago we went through a rough patch and I donated again to earn some money. I didnapost really tell her because I didnapost see it as a big deal and it wasnapost a lot of money. I got about £to tide us over for the week and we went on about our business. I forgot about it.However, the other week, they were chatting with friends who were experiencing fertility issues, and the topic of his previous donation cropped up, much to his weaposs surprise. The poster - who goes by the username u Spare-Ninja- - continued: My we was more shocked than I expected her to be. She looked visibly shaken but moved on quickly.When we got home she brought it up again and I explained the story and how I forgot about it over time and didnapost see it as a big deal. She got quite upset, saying I might have potential children that I donapost know about. I donapost have children I donapost know about because the only children I have are those Iaposve had with her, but she is insisting this is some form of betrayal. The unnamed man now feels quite guilty about the situation and wonders whether he should have just told his we at the time, realising that to her, this was a pretty big deal. One fellow Reddit user advised: As someone who conceived my children with donor sperm I do still feel you should have disclosed it. They aren’t your children but a lot of these kids grow up with a curiosity about where they came from. In fact, in my country, they have a legal right to their donor’s contact details once they turn  and donors need to sign a form acknowledging that before they can donate. No one is expecting you to be a parent but the chances of a kid popping up to say hi over the years aren’t zero and you should have prepared her for that possibility as a courtesy. Another wrote: At best you were inconsiderate, at worst you violated her trust... what  are you doing that she considers a big deal, that you arenapost sharing  I guarantee that sheaposs been rolling that thought around her head since.Do you have a sperm donation-related story to share  We pay for stories. title: im buying mum car mothers
story: Im buying mum a car for Mothers Day - Im scared to tell her where cash is fromFrances Bentley, who rakes in thousands selling steamy snaps online, says she can now afford to treat her mum to a new car - but added her mum has no idea where she gets her money fromFrances says her mum has no idea where her money comes from Image: Frances BentleyByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsA woman who makes thousands selling steamy snaps on an adult streaming site says sheaposs able to give her mum the best Motheraposs Day ever this year. Frances Bentley, who sells content to subscribers on Fanvuesays sheaposs treating her beloved mum to a brand new motor. But she claims her mum has absolutely no idea where her daughteraposs recent influx of cash has come from - and Frances is keeping her lips sealed. She reckons her mum wouldnapost approve of her unorthodox way of making money, so sheaposs decided what mum doesnapost know canapost hurt her.For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here Frances says her mum is prim and proper - andshe found out how her daughter was making money, the model would be in for a strict telling off.She said: “My mum thinks I just got promoted to an Office Manager and that I work from home. I tell her never to disturb me during ‘working hours’ as I’m so busy, when secretly I’m making thousands on Fanvue from dressing up in lingerie and filming raunchy videos all day.  Although she feels bad about keeping her job a secret, sheaposs hoping to give her mum a Motheraposs Day sheaposll never forget with her new gt. And Frances isnapost the only one raking in the cash from the Fanvue , with redhead beauty Kitty recently admitting she has made more than £, from taking lateral flow tests on camera - at the request of her fans. Kitty told The Mirror: Itaposs been drilled into us to test regularly so I’ve been a good girl and have been doing as I was told. People just like to watch me do them, and I’m happy to give them what they want. She said sheaposd become a pro at taking the tests after having to do hundreds on camera - and can swab her nose and throat without flinching by now.The model added she was donating money to NHS Charities Together for every lateral flow test she took on camera.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Mothers DayLingerieUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news mum-leaves-pals-stitches-over-"Optician makes series of funny shopping blundersByJulia BanimAudience WriterOlive Loveridge-Greene:,  Mar |comments An optician has been lovingly branded an idiot by amused family and friends after ordering the wrong sized household items online on no fewer than three separate occasions.Gemma Bramley, , from Nottingham, failed to read the online descriptions, leaving her stuck with a miniature rug, doormat, and mismatched handles.The mum-of-one, who gets paid to help others read and see better as a contact lens optician, says her series of shopping mishaps have led to plenty of teasing from loved ones.Gemmaaposs first error came about when she went to order a replacement handle for her hallway cupboard. However, despite measuring the handle herself, Gemma didnapost give the listing details a thorough read. When it arrived, it was massive. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Having apparently not learned her lesson, Gemma then went on order a replacement doormat, once again failing to read the small print. The product that arrived was just the bristle centre, which is said to be scarcely large enough to fit beath her -year-old partner Antaposs feet.And last week Gemma ordered what she believed to be a large white fluffy rug for her -year-old daughter. However, she was once again left chuckling away after unwrapping the flannel-sized order.Gemma said: All my friends and family think Iaposm an idiot for doing it so many times. The thing is, I measured the door handle exactly before going online so I thought I was buying the perfect replacement. When it arrived it was massive but I was determined to use it. My partner put it on for me and put it on wonky so the cupboard was super irritating. Next we ordered a doormat, not realising that the part we ordered was just the central bit, not it as a whole. It was very problematic for my partner as he has massive feet and I made him wipe them on the tiny matt whenever he came in. She continued: Then it all happened once again when my daughter wanted to buy a rug with her Christmas money and sent me over the Amazon link.Turns out neither of us read the listing properly and thought the one we were buying was what was photographed. We were a bit worried when a very small parcel arrived, and when we opened it, it was like a flannel. However, despite all her purchases arriving in all the wrong sizes, Gemma decided to make use of them anyway, and she says they still managed to do the trick. Gemma said: Iaposve kept them all eventhey are all on the small side. Iaposve learned to love them all as they have character. I’ve paid for it so Iaposm using it, evenI suffer.She has since shared pics of three order clangers to Facebook, in a humorous post that has clocked up  likes and counting.In the caption, Gemma wrote: I have a terrible habit of ordering things online without checking their size. Well, my offspring just ordered herself a rug and looks like she has the same affliction. Gemmaaposs followers have been left in stitches at her all-too-relatable mix-ups, with one person admitting, I do stuff like this all the time. I canapost measure to save my le. Another user wrote, I shouldn’t laugh but this is exactly what I do too, while a third laughed, That doormat is killing me!Do you have a shopping blunder to share  We pay for stories. title: my girlfriend thinks tricked naming
story: My girlfriend thinks I tricked her into naming our baby after my dead catA man who welcomed his first child last month claims he was the one to suggest her name. However, unbeknown to his girlfriend, this happened to be the name of his beloved childhood cat" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Man-with-a-stubble-and-closed-eyes-kissing-a-grey-British-Short-Hair-cats-head-on-sofa.jpg" width"" "" The cat died long before the couple metImage: Getty ImagesByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments After a pregnancy that took them both by surprise, a -year-old man and his girlfriend welcomed their new baby daughter to the world, naming her Clementine at the manaposs suggestion.The new father claims he has always loved the name, and, unbeknown to his girlfriend, it just so happened to be the exact same moniker he gave his pet cat when he was six years old.The cat died some years ago, long before he met his current girlfriend, and so he apparently didnapost think it would be too much of a big deal for his little girl to share a name with his old feline friend.However, the anonymous man says he was in for a stern telling-off after his mother dug out some old childhood photos to illustrate just how much he resembled baby Clementine. The girlfriend was taken by the pretty cat she spotted in a number of the photos and asked what the family had called it. But she didnapost much like the answer. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Taking to Reddit, the conflicted cat lover wrote: She remarked what a pretty cat it was and asked what her name was. I said it was funny because her name was also Clementine.She immediately got p***ed and asked me what the f**k was wrong with me. I was surprised by this and she started going in on me about how I tricked her into naming our daughter after a dead cat. We argued until she told me to take her home. The whole ride home we didn’t speak. When we got home she went into our room with the baby and hasn’t come out since.The poster - who goes by the username u ihgfgvf - went on to clary that heaposd named his daughter Clementine because he likes the name, not because he deliberately wanted to name her after a long-dead cat.Despite this clarication, many Reddit users feel he should have really given his girlfriend a heads up about the signicance of the name before they decided on Clementine. One person wrote: A lot of people donapost like naming their kids after a dead pet and given how long you had the cat I wouldnapost buy that you simply forgot the connection. You should have told her that you had a cat with the name and then let her decide how she felt about it with all the information. Another said: Instead of being honest about the name and the feelings behind it from the beginning, you purposely hid the fact youaposd had a cat of that name. You wouldnapost have felt it necessary to hide unless you had known it would be an issue, so I would argue itaposs very manipulative to omit that information until after your daughter had already been born and named.Do you have a baby name-related story to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news woman-astounds-cleaning-fans-little-"TikTok user shares cleaning hack for washing machineByJulia BanimAudience WriterAlexander Smail:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A woman who loves cleaning has stunned fellow enthusiasts with her clever trick to getting her washing machine drawer sparkling.Having previously had no clue that the drawer could be removed from the machine to be cleaned separately, the houseproud mum didnapost know how dirty it had become. The woman, whose name is Faith, managed to slide out the drawer after realising it had a little piece to push down, and was able to get a proper look at it. Noticing the compartment was looking rather grimy, Faith set about cleaning it using a simple yet effective combo of warm washing up liquid water, a toothbrush, and a cloth. After a lot of scrubbing, Faith was able to get her washing machine drawer sparkling once more, and many have been impressed by the satisfying results. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Taking to the Facebook group Cleaning tips and tricks with before and after pictures of her drawer, an incredulous Faith wrote: How on earth did I not know this drawer came out !I’m not officially an adult and love cleaning haha! Thank you everyone for your cleaning tips and tricks.  Many other members were similarly amazed by the apparently little-known hack, having also had no idea whatsoever that the drawer could be removed and scrubbed separately in this way. One astounded woman wrote: They say you learn something every day. Well, today I learned this thank you. Another gasped: I not know of this trickery either! Offering help to those who werenapost sure how to get their own drawers to budge, ious members whoaposve tried this hack before advised to press down in the middle of the drawer, right where the fabric softener is poured, before giving it a gentle pull. Weaposll definitely be giving this a go for ourselves!Do you have a cleaning tip or trick to share  We pay for stories. news world-news bidens-unplanned-putin-must-go-"Ukraine: Putin cannot remain in power says BidenByEd McConnell:,  Mar |comments Nine ad-libbed words at the end of Joe Bidenaposs fiery speech on Russiaaposs invasion of Ukraine sent officials scrambling to prevent global outrage. Veering off script and away from US foreign policy, the President finished a -minute address in Poland yesterday with “For God’s sake, this man [ Vladimir Putin ] cannot remain in power.Within minutes aides were trying to insist he was merely saying Putin cannot be allowed to exercise power over regional neighbours, rather than advocating for regime change. The latter would be at complete odds with the US and NATOaposs stated policy throughout the month-long conflict and risk making an already paranoid President Putin even more dangerous.After the speech, which came at the end of three days of meetings in Europe, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said: Thataposs not for Biden to decide. The president of Russia is elected by Russians. Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletinhere That view was echoed by UK Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi who said the overthrow of Putin for his actions in Ukraine is up to the Russian people. Interviewed on Sunday, Mr Zahawi said it is for the Russian people to decide how they are governed but suggested they would certainly do well to have someone who is democratic and understands their wishes. He told Skyaposs Sophy Ridge: The Russian people, I think, are pretty fed up with what is happening in Ukraine, this illegal invasion, the destruction of their own livelihoods, their economy is collapsing around them and I think the Russian people will decide the fate of Putin and his cronies.  But he declined to criticise Mr Biden, unlike Tobias Ellwood, the Conservative MP who chairs the Commons Defence Committee, who said Mr Putin will now spin this, dig in and fight harder. AskedMr Biden was wrong to issue the call, Mr Zahawi replied: No, what Iaposm saying to you is the White House has been very clear on this, the President gave a very powerful speech on this and I think both the United States and the United Kingdom agree that itaposs up to the Russian people to decide who should be governing them.  Biden has previously called Putin a “butcher”, “pure thug”, “murderous dictator and, most signicantly, a war criminal. The last comment was at the time dismissed by aides as speaking from the heart but within days US policy changed and Secretary of State Antony Blinken also used the term. That incident led some observers to speculate that Bidenaposs Putin must go comments pre-empt a policy switch. But the rapid back-pedalling and global distancing suggest it was instead the latest example of the -year-old departing from his carefully crafted speeches and misspeaking as a result. President Bidenaposs words came as multiple rockets struck the city of Lviv near the Polish border in the west of Ukraine. He had earlier said: If youaposre able to listen - you, the Russian people, are not our enemy. His comments were condemned by diplomats and foreign policy experts. Richard Haas, a veteran diplomat and president of the Council on Foreign Relations, told the Washington Post: “There ought to be two priorities right now: ending the war on terms Ukraine can accept, and discouraging any escalation by Putin. And this comment was inconsistent with both of those goals.“It discourages Putin from any compromise essentially —you’ve got everything to lose, it frees him up. Why should he show any restraint  And it confirms his worst fears, which is that this is what the United States seeks. His ouster and systemic change.” He added that the comments were frustrating as Putin would jump on them and the USapos response to the conflict has so far been incredibly disciplined. David Rothkopf, a foreign-policy analyst and CEO of the Rothkopf Group, said the comments would act as a lightning rod but defended the President saying he wasnapost wrong. Biden, a self-confessed gaffe machine, has previously been criticised for calling Barack Obama “the first mainstream African American who is articulate and bright and clean and a nice-looking guy at the launch of his  campaign. He was then caught on camera whispering an expletive in Obamaaposs ear at a bill signing. He later drew the then-Presidentaposs ire when he broke rank announced his support for same-sex marriage before it became official policy.And during his own campaign he called Theresa May Margaret Thatcher.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Joe BidenVladimir PutinUkraineRussiaRussia Ukraine war" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: blind mystic baba vanga who
story: Blind mystic Baba Vanga who predicted   said Putin will be Lord of the WorldThe psychic made hundreds of predictions in her -year career, including accurately predicting the sinking of the Kursk in . Her millions of followers believe she had paranormal abilities including telepathy and could communicate with aliensBaba VangaByGraeme Murray:,  Mar |commentsA blind mystic who foresaw the Russian war in Ukraine predicted Putin would become aposLord of the Worldapos Baba Vanga apossawapos may natural disasters and warned about conflicts before they happened. She died in the mid s aged , but the Eastern European hinted at what we could expect in the future and became known as aposNostradamus of the Balkansapos.It has now been suggested she predicted Vladimir Putin and Russia will dominate the world. In a meeting with writer Valentin Sidorov, Vanga in , BirminghamLive reported she said: “All will thaw, asice, only one remain untouched - Vladimir’s glory, glory of Russia.Too much it is brought in a victim. Nobody can stop Russia. All will be removed by her from the way and not only will be kept, but also becomes the lord of the world. ” Before her death, Vanga predicted glorious future for Russia once more, the Daily Post reported.According to the clairvoyant, Russia will be the world’s only superpower. She also made a chilling prophecy about the use of nuclear weapons and World War . Blinded after being picked up by a freak tornado as a child, Baba Vanga - born Vangelia Gushterova - believed she had the ability to foresee the future. She reportedly made hundreds of predictions in her -year career. She shot to prominence after accurately predicting the sinking of the Kursk in . Her millions of followers believe she had paranormal abilities including telepathy and being able to communicate with aliens.  Her numerous predictions about world events and the state of humanity have become infamous, including claims she predicted the rise of ISIS and the fall of the Twin Towers.The Irish Mirror also told of her chilling predictions today and how some of them have come true.Specialists have since calculated that  per cent of her prophecies had happened - slightly less than the  per cent claimed by her followers. These are some of her other previous predictions: The Kursk nuclear submarine disaster In  the blind prophetess predicted that in August of , “Kursk will be covered with water and the whole world will weep over it.” Kursk was a Russian sub that Sank in the Barents Sea on August , , killing all aboard.  In  Baba Vanga said: “Horror, horror! The American brethren will fall after being attacked by the steel birds. The wolves will be howling in a bush, and innocent blood will be gushing.” On September , , planes hijacked by Islamic extremists hit the World Trade Center in New York, killing thousands of people. Europe will cease to exist According to Baba Vanga, the continent will cease to exist by , and all that would remain will be empty spaces and wasteland, nearly devoid of any form of le. Clearly not exactly right, but the UK did vote to leave the EU on June , , creating a lot of turmoil. She is reported to have said that chemical weapons would be used by extremists against Europe . Barack Obama will be the last president of the US Baba Vanga had predicted that the th US president would be an African American, but she had also added that he would be the last one. She claimed he would leave office at a time when the country would be in economic ruins, and there would be a huge ide between the northern and southern states – as was the case during the American Civil War.Baba also appeared to predict that the th president of the United States - who we now know to be Donald Trump - would be faced with a crisis which would “bring the country down”.Her chilling prediction states: “Everyone will put their hopes in him to end it, but the opposite will happen he will bring the country down and conflicts between north and south states will escalate.” Some speculate the references to “north and south” could mean North and South Korea. World War III Baba’s predictions have been revisited after another mystic, who apparently foretold Donald Trump’s presidency, claims to know the exact date World War  will start. Self-proclaimed ‘messenger of God’ Horacio Villegas believes nuclear war will break out on the th anniversary of the visitation of Our Lady of Fatima. The clairvoyant claims to have envisioned Trump would win the US election as far back as . He reportedly predicted the billionaire businessman would become the “illuminati king” who will “bring the world into WW ”. The  Boxing Day Tsunami “Cold regions will become warm ... and volcanoes will awaken. “A huge wave will cover a big coast covered with people and towns, and everything will disappear beneath the water. Everything will melt, just like ice.” China rises According to the prophetess, China will become a world power in . She’s probably out a few years here as China is already an economic and military powerhouse. We’ve also apparently got a change in the Earth’s orbit to look forward to some time before . A golden age A new energy source will be created and global hunger will start to be eradicated between  and . A manned spacecraft to Venus will be launched. From  to  the polar ice caps will melt, causing ocean levels to rise. Cloning of organs Baba Vanga’s predicted that body organs will be cloned by , and that would be the easiest method of treatment. Red and green Between  and  a classless, Communist society will thrive hand in hand with newly-restored nature. Mars attacks! A LOT happens from  to , including a Mars colony becoming a nuclear power and demanding independence from the earth, the establishment of an underwater city and the discovery of something “terrible” during the search for alien le. Some time between  and  we’ll crack time travel. Meanwhile, French guerrillas fight the Muslim authorities in France. The “secrets of the moon” will be unveiled. The end of the world By , everything on Earth will cease to exist. However, humans will be advanced enough to move to a new star system. title: elon musk says tesla bot
story: Elon Musk says Tesla bot people can download personalities onto could be next yearPeople will one day be able to download their memories into the Tesla Bot, known as Optimus, which will start off le performing mundane tasks such as going shopping, billionaire genius Elon Musk saysElon Musk says people could download personalities into the Tesla Bot Image: REUTERSByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Eccentic tech genius and multi-billionaire Elon Musk says humans could take a step towards immortality thanks to a humanoid robot will one day allow people to download memories and personalities. And the the Tesla Bot - first unveiled by Musk’s company in August  - could be in production as soon as next year he claims.Optimus, described by Musk as as the “most important development”, will start out in le as a worker droid but its possibilities mean one day brain s may be able to be downloaded into it, once the technology is available.Musk, , told BusinessInsider : “Optimus is a general purpose, sort of worker-droid. The initial role must be in work that is repetitive, boring, or dangerous. Basically, work that people donapost want to do. Would you download your personality onto a robot  Have your say in the comment section “Optimus will be helpful with respect to dropping growth rates. Butthese things continue, then what happens  Humanity dies out. Is that what we want  “We could download the things that we believe make ourselves so unique. Now, of course,youaposre not in that body anymore, that is definitely going to be a dference, but as far as preserving our memories, our personality, I think we could do that. “Weaposve already amplied our human brains massively with computers. It could be an interesting ratio to roughly calculate the amount of compute that is digital, ided by the amount of compute that is biological.”  He added he was excited by the technology, but that there was some “trepidation” with the robots. Musk added: “With respect to AI and robotics, of course, I see things with some trepidation. “Because I certainly donapost want to have anything that could potentially be harmful to humanity. But humanoid robots are happening. Look at Boston Dynamics. They do better demonstrations every year. “The rate of advancement of AI is very rapid.”  Standing at about ft in tall and weighing  pounds, the Tesla Bot will be able to pick up essentials from shops as well as help fix cars with a spanner. Speaking last year at its unveiling, Musk said the robot could have a big impact across the world. The tycoon said: “Tesla is arguably the world’s biggest robotics company, our cars are basically semi-sentient robots on wheels. It kind of makes sense to put that technology on a humanoid form. We think weaposll probably have a prototype sometime early next year. Itaposs intended to be friendly, of course, navigate through a world built for humans, and eliminate boring, repetitive, dangerous tasks. news world-news putin-cannot-remain-power-tries-"Ukraine: Putin cannot remain in power says BidenByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Vladimir Putin cannot remain in power as he tries to rebuild an empire, Joe Biden has declared. The US President blasted Putin as a dictator in a stirring speech at theRoyal Castle in Warsaw, Poland.It comes after years of claims that Putin is desperate to re-establish Russian control over former Soviet Union countries.Biden denounced the despot after speaking to Ukrainian refugees in the Polish capital today.When asked what he thought of Putin after the meeting, the President said: Heaposs a butcher.In his speech outside theRoyal Castle, Biden added: In this hour, let the words of Pope John Paul burn as brightly today - never, ever give up hope, never doubt, never tire, never become discouraged. Be not afraid. A dictator bent on rebuilding an empire will never erase a peopleaposs love for liberty.Brutality will never grind down their will to be free. Ukraine will never be a victory for Russia, for free people refused to live in a world of hopelessness and darkness.We will have a dferent future, a brighter future, rooted in democracy and principle, hope and light, of decency and dignity, of freedom and possibilities. For Godaposs sake, this man cannot remain in power.  The White House later claried that Biden was not discussing regime change in Moscow. Instead he was emphasising that Russia should not be allowed to control its neighbours, a US official said. Biden also addressed the Russian people in his speech today, saying aposyou are not our enemyapos while warning that the Kremlinaposs actions in Ukraine was aposnotof a great nationapos Biden added: Of all people, you the Russian people, as well as all people across Europe still have the memory of being in a similar situation in the s and s, the situation of World War Two, still fresh in the mind of many grandparents in the region.  After sharing accounts of the horrors of World War Two, he added: These are not memories of the past - not any more, itaposs exactly what the Russian army is doing in Ukraine right now. The US president said Moscowaposs troops have met their match with brave and stf Ukrainian resistance and have strengthened the resolve and unity of both the defending forces and the West. Russia wanted less of a Nato presence on his border but now he has a stronger presence, a larger presence, he said.  Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Mr Biden said , Russians had left their country in a single month in a remarkable brain drain as Mr Putin, who he earlier called a butcher, had strangled democracy.Addressing the thousand-strong audience that included refugees who have fled the war, he told Ukrainians we stand with you - period as he defended the nationaposs president, Volodymyr Zelensky.Putin has the gall to say heaposs denazying Ukraine. Itaposs a lie, itaposs just cynical - he knows that, Mr Biden said. And itaposs also obscene. President Zelensky was democratically elected, heaposs Jewish, his fatheraposs family was wiped out in the Nazi holocaust and Putin has the audacity - like all autocrats before him - to believe that might will make right. news world-news russian-troops-firing-nuclear-reactor-"Ukraine: Fire near the Kharkiv Institute of Physics and TechnologyByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russian forces are firing at a nuclear research facility in the city of Kharkiv, Ukrainian officials said.The nationaposs parliament announced it was not possible to estimate the damage due to the ongoing clashes in the area. It comes two weeks after a previous Russian attack on Kharkivaposs Institute of Physics and Technology, which is home to a nuclear reactor core. A Ukrainian politician warned that the latest shelling risked a aposmajor environmental disasterapos.The State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate of Ukraine said: The continuation of its bombardment can lead to severe radiation consequences with contamination of nearby territories. Emine Dzheppar, Ukraineaposs first deputy minister of foreign affairs, added: The Russian aggressor fired rocket aposGradapos systems on the territory of the Kharkiv Institute, where the nuclear installation aposSource of Neutronsapos is located, in the active zone of which  fuel nuclear cells were loaded.The destruction of a nuclear facility and nuclear material storage facilities could lead to a major environmental disaster. Ukraine continues to gather evidence ofwar crimes to The Hague. The regulator previously accused Russia of committing an act of nuclear terrorism by bombing the research facility. In a statement the nuclear watchdog said: Prior to the Russian aggression, the Source of Neutrons was at the stage of physical start-up, during which the core was loaded with fresh nuclear fuel.  On February , , the unit was transferred to a deep subcritical state by the operational personnel of the Source of Neutrons. In a report on the state of the reactor, which is used in scientic research at the institute, the Inspectorate said critical buildings at the site had sustained damage during the attack but the reactor was in a deep subcritical state and completely de-energized. Video from the scene is understood to show huge flames at the centre, where the first development of a nuclear bomb was carried out in the USSR.  Ukraineaposs Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security posted on Twitter: In Kharkiv, eyewitnesses report a fire in the building of Kharkiv Institute of Physics and Technology. The building contains equipment which,damaged, can lead to radioactive pollution of the environment. After it was first targeted, authorities said the institute is home to a nuclear research facility with  nuclear fuel cells.  Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Before Russia ’s invasion of Ukraine, while Vladimir Putin ’s troops gathered on the border, Kharkiv was seen as one of the cities most at threat and it has withstood horric bombings and slaughter. The resistance of the city has typied the response from Ukrainians since Russia’s invasion on February  and residents have refused to surrender. Kharkiv Mayor Igor Terekhov said hundreds of buildings, many residential, had been destroyed. It is impossible to say that the worst days are behind us, we are constantly being bombed, he said. A witness in the city said she saw people on the roofs of apartment buildings dropping grenades or similar ordnance onto the streets as the resistance continues. news world-news teen-whose-outfit-made-male-"Teen sent home from school over inappropriate outfit that violated dress codeByDimitris KouimtsidisAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A student who was sent home from school over an outfit which made a male teacher feel “awkward” saw out her final year being taught at home due to stress. Karis Wilson was told her knee- black dress with lace trim over a long-sleeve white turtleneck reminded a female teacher of “lingerie” and made a male student teacher feel awkward, when she wore it to school.The -year-old was sent home and the encounter was so damaging she did notto school until her graduation at the end of the year.Her father Christopher Wilson initially complained about the incident on aFacebooklive video that went viral, with more than , views. He told the Daily Star : She wasnapost wearing it in a sexual manner. She wasnapost wearing it for attention. She normally wears track pants and a hoody. She had a snowboarding accident a month or two ago and couldnapost be active for a while. She had started going to the gym and feeling better about herself. Then one day she decided to wear a dress and feel good about herself, this is how they reacted. “She had lost more than a week of school and then she said ‘dad, I don’t know what to wear to school’. “She elaborated a little bit and said, ‘DadI wear just my track pants and hoodie,I wear something comfortable, am I conforming  “aposIf I wear something I feel pretty in, am I trying to rub it in their face ’”  Karis, a student at NorKam Secondary School in British Columbia, Canada, has now put the incident behind her and started her university education. Her dad told CBC News at the time:was told that it could possibly make the male student teacher feel awkward and it could makefeel awkward since it reminded her of a lingerie outfit. Itaposs actually a very modest outfit when you actually look at it... I think the initial comments were based on the fact that it had lace.” It was said in  that dad Christopher was told the teacher was a little bit old school after complaining to the principal.He said a teacher pulled Karis out of her class and escorted her to the principalaposs office on Tuesday. He claimed the principal later told him that she agreed the outfit was not inappropriate. Karisapos classmates staged a walkout the following day to show their support for her. At the time he added: There was a female who was singled out because what sheaposs wearing could make someone in a position of power over her feel uncomfortable. And the more you think of it, the more you say it, the more you understand that this is absurd.He initially complained about the incident in a live Facebook video that went viral, with more than , views.And now, speaking to the Daily Star in , Christopher said his daughter was confident thatshe could go back in time and change anything, she would do the same thing again. news world-news woman--married-man--"TikTok user reveals large age gap in her relationshipByRia Newman:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A woman married to a man twice her age has shared how she’s lost friends and faced nasty comments online as a result of the age gap between her and her husband.Savanna Miller, now , and husband Mark, , from Sydney, Australia, first matched on Tinder five years ago when she was just  - though she claims they hadn’t planned to meet up. They then happened to bump into each other on a night out and realised how much they clicked. The pair soon fell in love and married in February . They now have plans to start a family together in the future. Savanna’s family have been supportive, with her mum, who is just seven years older than Mark, even calling him her son. Love who you love and don’t be swayed by others, Savanna said. I am so grateful for the friends I lost to this relationship. At the end of the dayyour friends donapost support you no matter what, they aren’t friends worth having. “Both of our parents were completely fine [with our relationship].My mom calls him son and she’s only seven years older than Mark . He’s really close with my family and vice versa.” From the minute they met, Savanna says she felt dferent about Mark compared to other boyfriends and their relationship quickly grew. She said: “I actually wasn’t physically attracted to my previous boyfriends and wasn’t intimate with any of them. Donapost get me wrong, they are lovely, wonderful guys and I am still great friends with them but physically there was no attraction – despite other girls my age always liking them.“I guess with Mark what’s really incredible is having a physical attraction to him as well as the depth of conversation we can have. It feels like we are teammates as well as lovers, just constant support on both ends to be who we are and true to ourselves.” Although neither Mark nor Savanna had been in a relationship with an age gap before, they never felt it was an issue. She said: “Our relationship just moved from stage to stage naturally with no verbal confirmations. “Neither of us brought it up with the other. We didn’t really voice any concerns. I guess I had in the back of my mind that he may not think I am in the right stage of my le to be serious but we both gave it a shot and we found us both to be in the same stage and in agreement with where and how we were.” After they got together, Savanna introduced Mark to her family and luckily it went really well.But other relationships have suffered because she chose to be with him, including close friendships. She said: “His friends were fine and wonderful and a lot of them are actually some of my best friends now. “My friends in the main were great but I lost two of my best friends because they couldn’t understand that you can get along and be from dferent generations and I guess they had conservative small-minded views of relationships. “I have always deemed myself lucky to have lost them as I donapost believe friends are real friendsthey don’t support you regardless of their own view – we have dferent lives and should support each other regardless of our own opinions.” In late , they decided to get married. Savanna said: Neither one of us is overly romantic and he had been asking stating we should get married for about a month in late  and I just laughed it off every time. One day we were on our way to play lawn bowls with our friends and we were at our favourite cafe called the Tennyson Bistro in Napier, New Zealand, eating smoked salmon bagels and he just said aposPick a date and letaposs get marriedapos.  I laughed and said a random date and he agreed and four months later we were married. The pair had a small wedding with just their closest friends and family on  February , on the balcony of their home. Now, the couple have plans to expand their family at some point in the future. Savanna said: “We are both into the idea of having children but are in no rush. As always we have to plan and discuss everything we do so we have pencilled it in for four years. “For now, we want lots of adventures, travel and success. We have already moved across the country and then moved countries twice now and we would like to keep doing that – exploring and finding opportunities to grow together. Le should be an adventure and settling down doesn’t have to mean staying in one place.” The pair also post about their relationship on TikTok, where they have over , followers. While most of the comments they get are positive, the pair say they do get a few negative responses – but they don’t let it bother them. Savanna said: Itaposs wonderful because we [get] hundreds of messages from people who are in the same boat but donapost have our confidence, and say our TikTok makes them feel better about their relationship. We are helping people ignore the judgement.There are sort of generic comments which makes me think people don’t really think too deeply and repeat what they’ve seen on Facebook. Itaposs just things like “this is so wrong” and “He could be your dad!”I just sit there trying to mature and not comment back aposcould be your dad next time Sharonapos. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Courier ePaper.The new website is now live. title: scottish agritourism
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. title: young farmers thainstone
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. title: teacher of nearly 40 years struck off
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists.
